DOC.brief_summary: Childhood influenza coverage rates are far below rates for the other childhood vaccinations. Increasing influenza vaccine coverage rates is important not only for the health of the child, but for that of the child's household and community. Yet,influenza vaccine delivery rates at pediatric clinics are low, even when the vaccine is available. The proposed project will take advantage of existing health information technology to tailor, implement and evaluate influenza vaccine alerts in the electronic health record (EHR) for pediatric providers to help improve health care decision making.
DOC.brief_title: FluAlert: Influenza Vaccine Alerts for Providers in the Electronic Health Record
DOC.criteria: Medical (medical doctor/nurse practitioner (MD/NP)) or nursing providers (registered nurse, licensed practical nurse (RN/LPN)) at participating practices Parents of a child 6 months 18 years who is a patient at one of the participating ACN practice Parents fluent in English or Spanish Children 6 months 18 years with visit to participating practice during influenza season
